intro: Silene laciniata subsp. laciniata, commonly known as the fringed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers and hairy, branched stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and often divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Silene laciniata subsp. laciniata is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is known for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
